Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2008 07:17AM heresmary wrote: I just had a MRI breast bilateral with gadolintum & 3D with image postprocessing done yesterday.  Now more waiting on the reading from all that. I'm really trying to stay positive, but down deep inside I feel that it is going to be bad. Lately I've been having dreams about not being able to open my eyes & I'm always with my parents who have both passed away many years ago.  I can feel the crying stage coming back, I'm so scared.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed heresmary heresmary

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2008 06:35PM heresmary wrote: Yes, in the beginning, Tina I didn't think I would ever stop crying.  Hearing the doctor tell me you have breast cancer. Thinking was he talking to me? I couldn't believe my ears, I wished that my Mother was there to talk with. (She passed away 34 yrs ago)  I'm trying to stay positive & yet I have this gut feeling that my nodes aren't going to come back clean.  I'm also waiting for the insurance company to okay my MRI, so we can be sure that the rest of my left breast is clear as well as the right.  Actually, I've already had the tumor removed but going back in to take more tissue, & some nodes. Thanks, for listening & giving me support.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed heresmary heresmary

Posts.Content: heresmary wrote: I was just diagnosed with breast cancer May 20, 2008.  I don't need to tell you the shock I felt, it seem most of the women here went through the same feelings. This site has been very helpful to me in deciding which course to take, Mastectomy or Lumpectomy. It has also give me hope from reading other conversations & stories on here. I'm going back into surgery on June 19 for a Lumpectomy & to have some lymph nodes removed.  Then the waiting game for pathology report to see if it has spread & what stage. Of course, I fear the worst & I'm trying to keep my thoughts positive. Mary Dx 5/20/2008, IDC, 1cm, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed heresmary heresmary

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2008 05:24PM heresmary wrote: Thank you rogam, some times the "what if's" do come creeping in to my head.  It's rough sitting here waiting for the next surgery, & the pathology report to come back.  I'll be glad when I can put this all behind me.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed heresmary heresmary
